item.title: Information Session: 2026 Project RFP: IBM-RPI Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC) Quantum Computing Track | Oct. 27
item.description: Join us via Microsoft Teams on Monday, October 27, from 4:00–5:00 PM (ET) for an Information Session on the Track-4: Accelerate Quantum Computing Research (2026 Projects) RFP. The Future of Computing Research Center (FCRC)—a partnership between RPI and IBM—advances innovation in AI algorithms, hardware-software co-design, semiconductor technologies, and quantum computing. This session will outline research topics of interest, the proposal template, and submission timelines for Track-4 projects,…

item.title: 2025 Annual Electrical & Steam Shutdowns
item.description: The Annual Utility Shutdown for Assessment and Repair will occur Saturday, May 10th - Saturday May 17th, 2025. The central steam plant will be shut down and there will be selective power outages throughout the campus. Review the Steam Shutdown and Electrical Outages spreadsheets for your building. Contact Ms. Lynn Gray, grayl4@rpi.edu with questions or concerns. Work is done on the main Rensselaer campus annually.

item.title: 10/29 Cognitive Science Colloquium: “Logic as Applied Mathematics” with Dr. Graham Priest
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department on Wednesday, October 29th, at 12pm in Carnegie 113 for a presentation by Dr. Graham Priest titled “Logic as Applied Mathematics”. Dr. Priest is currently Distinguished Professor of Philosophy at the Graduate Center, City University of New York, Boyce Gibson Professor Emeritus at the University of Melbourne, and has visiting positions at the Ruhr University of Bochum (Germany), Tohoku University (Japan), and Shandon University (China).

item.title: iEAR Presents: Decolonial Practices in Film Workshop with Suneil Sanzgiri | Oct. 29
item.description: Join us Oct 29 starting at 4:30pm at the Sanctuary for Independent Media. The program opens with a workshop session on film practice. Sanzgiri and Suchak/ Youth FX reflect on the practical work of filmmaking and consider its impact on the histories and communities it engages. The workshop is followed by a dinner for participants, and a concluding screening of works from Sanzgiri’s series Golden Jubilee.
